Several other areas of inquiry that we would've asked about include
communications that Senator Mastriano had with the Trump campaign before and after
election day in November of 2020, including communications that he had had with Rudy
Giuliani and Mr. Giuliani's team.
We would've also asked about Senator Mastriano's involvement and
understanding of a hearing that took place on November 25th, 2020, in Gettysburg at a
Wyndham Hotel that was related to the election.
We would've also asked about Senator Mastriano's understanding of purported
fraud in the election and several statements that he made publicly about his
understanding and perception of issues related to the November 2020 Presidential
election.
We would've asked Senator Mastriano about direct communications that he had
with the President related to the election and the joint session of Congress.
We would've also asked about Senator Mastriano's involvement in or knowledge
of Republican electors who met to cast electoral college votes in December 2020 for
President Trump in States that President Trump had lost, including in Pennsylvania, and
any role that he had in the convening of those electors, including electors who met at the
Pennsylvania State capitol.
We would've asked Senator Mastriano about financing for buses who brought
people to Washington, D.C., on January the 6th.
We would've asked about various letters that Senator Mastriano signed or
apparently sent to -- that were addressed to Members of Congress, the Acting Deputy
Attorney General, and the Vice President, including letters that he emailed to the White
House directly and the President's personal assistant.
We would've asked about Senator Mastriano's presence in Washington, D.C., at or
near Capitol Hill on January the 6th.
We would've also asked about Senator Mastriano's attendance at the President's
rally on January 6th at the Ellipse.
We would've asked about calls that Senator Mastriano may have had with the
President or members of the White House or other officials on January 6th, including a
call that he apparently placed to the Vice President on the 6th.
And we would've also asked about communications he had -- Senator Mastriano
had, to be clear -- with the President after January 6th about that day and related to the
election or the joint session of Congress.
With that, I'll stop and see if anybody else has anything to add.
